alert.note: Alert for Bath (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:41PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Alleghany, western Bath Counties in west central Virginia and central Greenbrier Counties in southeastern West Virginia through 215 PM EDT... At 141 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Falling Spring, or over Renick, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Renick... Neola... Falling Spring... Lake Moomaw... Beartown State Park... Trout... and Rorer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
